## PR Title Format

<!--
⚠️ IMPORTANT: Your PR title becomes the commit message when merged!
Use conventional commit format for the PR title:

  feat: add new feature
  fix: resolve bug description
  docs: update documentation
  refactor: improve code structure
  feat!: breaking change description

Examples:
  ✅ feat: add batch video processing
  ✅ fix: resolve memory leak in FFmpeg service
  ❌ Update video merger
  ❌ Fixed bug
-->

- [ ] My PR title follows conventional commit format

## Type of Change

- [ ] `feat` - New feature (minor version bump)
- [ ] `fix` - Bug fix (patch version bump)
- [ ] `feat!` / `fix!` - Breaking change (major version bump)
- [ ] `docs` - Documentation only (no version bump)
- [ ] `refactor` / `perf` / `chore` - Other (patch version bump)

## Checklist

- [ ] I have tested my changes locally
- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have updated documentation if needed
